conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine variable linear motion.
The graph shows the velocity of the particle as a function of time.
The graph shows a straight line with a constant velocity.
Straight line with constant velocity indicates constant linear motion.
The graph shows a constant velocity of 2 m/s from 0 to 3 seconds.
Since velocity is constant, there are no changes in velocity over 3 seconds.
Motion is not variable as velocity remains constant throughout the interval.
Conclude particle does not undergo variable linear motion.
